snippet: The Senate voted to finally eliminate cold war-era trade restrictions on Russia, but at the same time it condemned Moscow for human rights abuses.
abstract: Senate votes 92-4 to pass bill eliminating cold war-era trade restrictions on Russia, while also condemning country for human rights abuses, threatening to further strain an already delicate relationship with the Kremlin.

byline.contributor: Ellen Barry contributed reporting from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: The Senate voted to finally eliminate cold war-era trade restrictions on Russia, but at the same time it condemned Moscow for human rights abuses.

headline.seo: Senate Passes Russian Trade Bill, With a Human Rights Caveat
headline.main: U.S. Senate Passes Russian Trade Bill, With a Human Rights Caveat
headline.print_headline: Senate Passes Russian Trade Bill, With a Human Rights Caveat

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
